page.title: 10LYME REGIS ADVENTURE CENTRE
page.content: Built by R.A.F as life boat station. Became residential centre for Dorset school parties in 1960. Situated by the coast near the Cobb. Financed by Dorset County Council as an educational out-door centre. During term time school parties of 30 children and 2 staff come from Monday-Friday or Friday-Sunday. In the Summer Holidays are adventure courses for individuals. The centre is open all year round except for a month at Christmas. The Duke Of Edinburgh Awards,A level Geology, Geography and Field Studies also take place. Five members of staff as well as temporary people in Summer. Field Studies include surveys of the town, beach,river and fossiling. Some activities include canoeing, sailing, camping and treking on Dartmoor.
